page.title: 04FARMING-BURLINGHAM FARM
page.content: }The farmer lives in an old farmhouse made of Hamstone and painted white,except around the windows which are left as unpainted Hamstone.The house was mullioned,leaded windows and blue stone slabs have been used for the fence.The garden is somewhat overgrown,with some fruit trees,and bushes.The farm is mainly livestock,with sheep and cattle,including Fresians.The farmer believes in keeping his hedges,as the area is flat and windy and thus they act as windbreaks,as well as preserving some of the wildlife.The newly built dual carriageway is a mixed blessing,providing faster travel but also destroying many hedgerows.
